DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of post-partum maternal vitamin A supplementation on breast milk bioactive compounds and immune status, growth and morbidity of children in the first four months of life.
DOC.brief_title: Stopping Postpartum Vitamin A Supplementation: Missing Concealed Benefit
DOC.detailed_description: The effect will be assessed by the milk and blood.
DOC.criteria: Pregnant women >18 years of age with lowrisk obstetric Pregnant women expecting a multiple birth Take vitamin A supplements during postpartum apart from study intervention Premature birth Newborn babies with birth defects and / or other serious diseases
